title: Is there a way out of ELO hell for Support mains?
body: So title basically says it all. I know I know if your good enough you can carry yourself from ELO hell... And to that I say bullshit. How is a Support supposed to get out solo when you deal with griefers trollers and afkers?  Not saying I am a god tier support player by any means but I am a good support at the very least mid gold. So anyone got some tips?  Maybe ill even stream if someone wanted to give tips. I dunno but this is becoming infuriating.

In comparison to season one and two.
In the first two seasons supports got much less in resources. The role was played by going through laning to get a gold per second item or two (philosopher stone and heart of gold.) Both gave weak stats.
Supports would get boots of mobility, and then their build was done.
You would then spend all of your money on wards and oracles lens(400g for 3mins or until death.) The equivalent to sweeping lens but active all the time. 

You would spend almost your entire time warding, and clearing wards.

Because the game had less anti snowball mechanics, you could end up 6 levels behind people in game. 

With this small amount of insight, one should know that it would be much harder for someone to have any control over teamfights, and therefore the game was almost impossible to carry.


Supports now get more gold, free wards, never fall more than 4 levels behind, and have been buffed at the end of season 3/ beginning of season 4 to scale better with the items they did get (Janna's recent ult ap scaling was put was needed, that was a buff from that time. Ap lulu mid/top became common a short while after this. etc.)

Now I would love to hear your perspective as to how it is not harder to carry in S1-S2 as support.

> [{quoted}](name=Lyless,realm=NA,application-id=WEuoGbmp,discussion-id=ZVBV0N6J,comment-id=000200000001000000000001,timestamp=2015-09-15T07:28:33.995+0000)
>
> the part where you say it's easier to climb now. Utter lie.


In a way it is easier. As a support I keep track of jungle timers on dragon or baron or red and blue buffs. 2 seasons ago there was no dragon buff tracker.
2 seasons ago also didn't have these fancy support starter items we have now. Before people would start with a fairy charm, 2 wards and a bunch of potions. Gold generation on supports was super low and a support almost never got more than 2-3 completed items per game. There were no trinkets (free wards) either.
2 seasons ago there was also the assassin meta. You want to make a support feel useless? Get someone who can instagib their carries faster than the supports can peel for them. When Kassadin and LeBlanc were strong there was zero counter.
The only thing that is harder now as the support is that there is now a ward cap. No champion can have more than 3 wards placed at one time. In season 3 the support was the primary (and sometimes only) warder on the team and could place as many wards as they could carry with them.

So yeah, the game is indeed easier to carry through the support role.

Enemy top burned {{summoner:12}} getting back to their tower? You now have 4 mins for your top laner to shove their lane and gank bot by using their {{summoner:12}} to the ward you placed in the back of the lane bush before manipulating the wave to push into your tower and seal the gank. Build stacking items to taunt the enemy team and make them focus you instead of your idiot teammates (don't die if you do this). Build split pushing items like {{item:3512}} {{item:3060}} to divide the enemy's strength.

These are just a few of the things you can do to, you know, play better.

This season i have climbed from literally bronze 5 to s1 in promo to gold. So soon to be gold. I main ADC and play a mean vik mid. In bronze I realized that i had to main what made me win. So if you look me up i have 30 or so games on Udyr in the jungle. And then Nasus in the top. Unfortunately you have to play what will make you win. In ELO hell, you need to understand that 1) you most likely need to get better mechanically and 2) you need to play what makes you win. Try other roles but keep your "main" support. once you get to mid silver it gets better. But until then just play what you have to, to win, because maining support in bronze is like trying to win a fight blindfolded and both your hands tied behind your back.
